title: Information concerning Teri Paul email between public officials

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Information concerning Teri Parks email between public officials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All messages including text, documents, notes, or emails which have been forwarded, originated from or were addressed or cc'd to: sundog2014@yahoo.com from the present going back to Jan. 1, 2018. If this takes less than an hour,  please do not charge me.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Information concerning Teri Parks email between public officials
communications.communication:
I am amending my request in light of the impact voiced by Patrick Coleman at Oct. 10 City Council meeting to include metadata and not contents, for the time being, to aid his office in performing their diligence with less time required.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent To, From, CC, or BCC the following accounts:

sundog2014@yahoo.com - Teri Park, advisory member of Parks and Rec board


Please provide me the following information for all emails sent from Jan. 1 2018 to the present to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email.

I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.
---------

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Information concerning Teri Parks email between public officials
communications.communication:
The City of Cortez adopted Resolution No. 26, Series 2022, to implement the Colorado Open Records Act, C.R.S. § 24-720201.1, et seq. (“CORA”).  CORA allows the City to make reasonable rules and regulations concerning the copying and inspection of public records.  One of the rules the City requires is that a person or entity that desires to request public records from the City must complete the City’s standard CORA request form, a copy of which is attached.  Any person or entity may submit a CORA request using the proper form.  Please find attached the form which is required for a CORA request for the City of Cortez.  Thank you.

Linda L. Smith
City Clerk
City of Cortez
www.cortezco.gov

communications.subject: CORA Request -Jeter1
communications.communication:
Please note the following response:

Although the Amended Request was submitted “Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act,” which is not applicable to the City of Cortez, and the request requested emails from or to “Teri Park,” the City assumes that the person’s last name was a typo and the correct name to search is “Teri Paul,” who is a current member of the City’s Parks, Recreation, and Forestry Advisory Board, the City is processing this request pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, C.R.S. § 24-72-200.1, et seq. (CORA), and will search using the name of Teri Park.  A search of the requested metadata and the staff time to review the documents to ensure that no statutory exceptions exist preventing the release or requiring the redaction of the documents, is estimated to take a minimum of three hours.   Pursuant to CORA, there is no charge for the first hour, and every hour thereafter is charged at $33.58 per hour, for an estimated minimum fee of $67.16.  Please provide payment to the City Clerk’s Office of 50% of the estimated fee, or $33.58 to allow the City to begin processing your request.  The City is extending the time to respond to this request due to the extenuating circumstances, including the City having to devote all or substantially all of its resources to meeting an impending deadline concerning another CORA request, the uncertainty of the name search, and the uncertainty of the statutory basis for the records request.






Linda L. Smith
City Clerk
City of Cortez
www.cortezco.gov

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request #Jeter 1
communications.communication:
Thank you for the PDF copy. As per the original request I have two questions. 

1) Is it a typo that the first hour was charged? I was under the understanding the first hour was free. Please categorize the time required to handle this, and what staff by name and department were involved because the output requested was trivial and not meant to have to be output as a page within a PDF, along with the time to screen three pages. $33 seems excessive to review three pages as produced.

2) The original request stipulated an electronic format if possible. "E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format." Is it possible to have this file uploaded within the email rather than the PDF output? If not, please explain why this is not possible. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request #A23-01453
communications.communication:
DPD indicated they do not have the record you have requested.  I will send an official response soon.

Jack Dietrich, Supervising Assistant Corporation Counsel City of Detroit Law Department
313-237-5030

This communication, along with any attachments, is intended only for the use of the addressee and contains legally privileged and confidential information.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of any information contained in, or attached to this communication, is strictly prohibited and you are requested to contact the sender for instructions to return the document.

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request #A23-01453
communications.communication:
Hi Jack,

Thanks for the response. My request may have been unclear. Are you indicating that DPD does not keep records of arrests in a table, file, database, or anything like that?

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request #A23-01453
communications.communication:
Correct, that is what they have informed me so.

Jack Dietrich, Supervising Assistant Corporation Counsel City of Detroit Law Department
313-237-5030

This communication, along with any attachments, is intended only for the use of the addressee and contains legally privileged and confidential information.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of any information contained in, or attached to this communication, is strictly prohibited and you are requested to contact the sender for instructions to return the document.

communications.subject: RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request #A23-01453
communications.communication:
Hi Jack,

When an arrest is made, documentation or paperwork of some kind is generated—the kind of thing that would show up in ICHAT. I'm not aware of any U.S. police agencies that do not generate criminal records.

What wording could I use in my request to refer to those records?

Thanks,
Josh

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request #A23-01453
communications.communication:
There are records of arrests, you indicated you wanted a summary and specifically indicated you did not want the underlying records.

Jack Dietrich, Supervising Assistant Corporation Counsel City of Detroit Law Department
313-237-5030

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Turgut Özal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Turkish prime minister Turgut Özal (13 October 1927 – 17 April 1993). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act.

Özal was born in Turkey and worked for the State Electrical Power Planning Administration from 1950 to 1952. He studied electrical energy and engineering management in the United States from 1952 to 1953, and returned to Turkey to work for the same government organization until 1958. Özal worked at the World Bank from 1971 to 1973, served as undersecretary to Prime Minister Süleyman Demirel from 1979 to 1980 and was appointed state minister and deputy prime minister in charge of economic affairs from 1980 to 1982.

Ḧe founded the Motherland Party (Turkish: Anavatan Partisi) in 1983. Özal was elected Prime Minister of Turkey later that year, and served in that office until he became President of Turkey in 1989, later dying in office. Özal maintained close relations with U.S. President George H.W. Bush throughout the end of the Cold War and the beginning of the post Cold War era.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an investigative journalist who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

    Please see attached for description.

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1485823-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1485823-000
communications.communication:
To whom this may concern,

I hope this message finds you well. My name is Matthew Petti adn I am writing in regards to FOIPA Request No. 1485823-000 for records regarding former Turkish prime minister Turgut Ozal. In a 17 November 2023 letter, attached below, Section Chief Michael G. Seidel wrote that "In an effort to provide you with responsive records as expeditiously as possible, we are releasing documents from previous requests regarding your subject. We consider your request fulfilled. Since we relied on previous results, additional records potentially responsive to your subject may exist. If this release of previously processed material does not satisfy your request, you may request an additional search for records."

I am requesting an additional search for records. Thank you for your continued attention to this matter, and feel free to reach out with any questions you may have.

Best regards,
Matthew Petti

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1485823-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 122 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 1,230 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,010 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,370 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I need copies of all 1357(g) agreements between the Department of Homeland Security or any DHS component and the State of Texas, the Texas Military Department, the Texas State Guard, or any other government organization belonging to or affiliated with the State of Texas. I am not looking for 1357(g) agreements between DHS or its components and any local or municipal governments. 

I am willing to pay up to $25.00 without prior authorization.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

ANDREW FELS

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2023-ICFO-42684
communications.communication:
09/12/2023Andrew Fels263 Huntington AvenueBoston, Massachusetts 02115RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-42684	Department of Homeland Security FOIA Case No. 2023-HQFO-01893        Dear Requester:This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security, dated 6/12/2023, and seeking records pertaining to copies of all 1357(g) agreements between the Department of Homeland Security or any DHS component and the State of Texas, the Texas Military Department, the Texas State Guard, or any other government organization belonging to or affiliated with the State of Texas. I am not looking for 1357(g) agreements between DHS or its components and any local or municipal governments..While processing your request, the Department of Homeland Security located records that fall under the purview of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).  Accordingly, your request was referred to this office for processing and direct response to you.  Your request was received in this office on 9/5/2023.Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Per §5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period.  As the subject matter of your request is of substantial interest to two or more components of this Department or of substantial interest to another agency, we will need to consult with those entities before we issue a final response.  Due to these unusual circumstances, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued.If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Fernando Pineiro Jr. at the address above or (866) 633-1182.  Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.Your request has been assigned reference number 2023-ICFO-42684. Please use this number in future correspondence. Sincerely,ICE FOIA OfficeImmigration and Customs EnforcementFreedom of Information Act Office500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009Washington, D.C. 20536-5009 
This message (including any attachments) contains confidential information intended for a specific individual and purpose, and is protected by law. If you are not the intended recipient, you should delete this message and any disclosure, copying, or distribution
 of this message, or the taking of any action based on it, by you is strictly prohibited. 
Deloitte refers to a Deloitte member firm, one of its related entities, or Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited ("DTTL"). Each Deloitte member firm is a separate legal entity and a member of DTTL. DTTL does not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about
 to learn more.

communications.subject: ICE Response to Requester (Records publicly available)
communications.communication:
01/05/2024 

Andrew Fels 
263 Huntington Avenue 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2023-ICFO-42684 

Dear Requester: 

This is the final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) dated 9/5/2023. You are seeking copies of all 1357(g) agreements between the Department of Homeland Security or any DHS component and the State of Texas, the Texas Military Department, the Texas State Guard, or any other government organization belonging to or affiliated with the State of Texas. I am not looking for 1357(g) agreements between DHS or its components and any local or municipal governments. 

These documents are available on the public ICE website at: https://www.ice.gov/identify-and-arrest/287g 

The list of participating agencies are located by scrolling down the front page. 

If you deem this to be an adverse determination, you may exercise your appeal rights.  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.8. You may submit your appeal electronically at GILDFOIAAppeals@ice.dhs.gov or via regular mail to: 

U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security 
500 12th Street, S.W., Mail Stop 5900 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5900 

Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 

Provisions of FOIA allow DHS to charge for processing fees, up to $25, unless you seek a waiver of fees.  In this instance, because the cost is below the $25 minimum, there is no charge. 

If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact FOIA Public Liaison Daniel Edgington at (866) 633-1182 or 500 12th St. SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009.  Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennesee DOT Shelby County Project
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Relating to the SR-14/US-61 Bridges project over ICRR and Nonconnah Creek in Shelby County, Tennessee:

All RFP Responses from Contractors for the project.
All RFP Responses for Designers for the project.
The Executed Preconstruction Phase Contract for the Contractor.
The Executed Design Phase Contract for the Design Team.
The Contractor Selection Scoring Sheet and any supporting backup documentation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Mitchell Garner.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Multivehicle Accident in Tacoma, WA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All police investigative material for the loss that happened on 08/16/2023 at 17.00 on WB SR 16 Ramp and I-5 SB, Tacoma, WA-Pierce County. The named officer is Andrew Simmonds- Badge 481- WSP. 
Please provide us with pictures obtained from the accident scene, sketches, body camera footage, and investigative notes and documents. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Steve with Custard Insurance Adjusters

title: Child care provider data 2019-present (Maryland Department of Education)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Child care provider data 2019-present (Maryland Department of Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
1) Provider name or ID
2) Provider address
3) Latest license issue date and expiration date 
4) First license issue date
5) Enrollment, including dates on which enrollment was recorded (by child age groups if available)
6) Capacity, including dates on which capacity was recorded (by child age groups if available)
7) Prices, including dates on which prices were recorded (by child age groups if available)
8) Quality Rating and Improvement System (QRIS) scores, including dates on which scores were recorded
9) Any additional provider data that your agency collects

If electronic records from before 1/1/19 are available, I’d be happy to collect them as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All policies, practices, procedures, rules, or orders concerning the use of force.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Blake Feldman

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request: Vigilant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with either Motorola Solutions, Vigilant, or Vigilant Solutions for the use of license plate readers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Please see attached.

Your FOIA request is approved, and the records are attached.

Certain information is redacted from the records for the following reason(s):

  *   FOIA Exemption 140/7(1)(b) in that the information is private information that is unique to that individual and therefore may not be released in order to prohibit any concern of identity theft.
  *   FOIA Exemption 140/7(1)(c) in that the information contains personal information whereas the disclosure would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.

You have the right to file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor of the Attorney General's Office of Illinois by submitting a written request to:
Public Access Bureau
500 S. 2nd Street
Springfield, IL  62706
Public.access@ilag.gov<mailto:Public.access@ilag.gov> or 877-299-FOIA

The Request for Review must be submitted within 60 calendar days from the last response of the public body.  Your request must be in writing and include a copy of the FOIA response, along with your signature.  The Public Access Counselor has 60 calendar days to respond.  You also have the right to seek judicial review by filing a lawsuit in the circuit court.


Sam Temes
Executive Assistant
Burr Ridge Police Department
630-323-8181 ext. 5120

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Hedge Fund Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

You kindly sent us copies of your records that show information as listed below dated to June 30 2023. Please will it be possible to have an update on any records that would show some or all of the following information:

1. A list of ALL hedge funds and fund of hedge funds in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and

2. For each hedge fund and fund of hedge funds, may I please have a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:

a. the month by month market value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in each fund from July 1 2023 to September 30 2023,

b. the month by month amount invested by Richmond Retirement System in each fund from July 1 2023 to September 30 2023,

c. the month by month net returns (net of fees) earned by Richmond Retirement System on its investment in each fund from July 1 2023 to September 30 2023,

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

Sincerely,

Nanette Lee

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Haley Parker.

Kia Johnson
FOIA officer

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Hedge Fund Request

Here is the correct request.  Sorry for the confusion.

Kia Johnson

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Theresa Corley missing person's report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The missing person's report regarding Theresa Corley, Bellingham MA filed on or about December 5, 1978. The log book entries for December 3rd and 4th 1978

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

GERALDINE HOUDE

communications.subject: Re: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Theresa Corley missing person's report
communications.communication:
Good Morning Geraldine,
Per your request listed above; the log of Theresa Corley being reported
missing is attached.  Ms. Corley was reported missing on December 6, 1978.
I also contacted NCIC/CJIS to do an offline search for the TT entry and
they do not go back that far due to the fact of the missing person being
found.  If a person is still missing then the record stays active.
The logs for December 3 and 4 1978 are also attached.
Please let me know if we can be of further assistance.
Best Regards,
Kristin

title: Request for Probation Departments: Employee Salaries and Use of Force Training Documents (Orange County)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Probation Departments: Employee Salaries and Use of Force Training Documents (Orange County)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information:

A complete list of all employees, their job titles, and their annual salary for the last Three years (2020 and 2023).

Please provide all training documents related to the use of force within the agency, including but not limited to manuals, protocols, guidelines, and any related memos or communications.
I am making this FOIA request with any and all agencies that may have the requested information.

The purpose of this request is to gather information that will aid in a research project examining agency practices related to the use of force. The information requested will be used to assess the extent to which agency training on the use of force has been effective. This research project is being conducted as part of a larger effort to promote greater accountability and transparency within law enforcement agencies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan

communications.subject: COUNTY FOIL REQUEST :: R000506-042823
communications.communication:
Dear Jordan Jordan: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Orange County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of New York's Freedom of Information Law (FOIL). Your request was received in this office on 4/28/2023 and given the reference number R000506-042823 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: Subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Probation Departments: Employee Salaries and Use of Force Training Documents (Orange County)

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: I am writing to request the following information:

A complete list of all employees, their job titles, and their annual salary for the last three years (2020 and 2023). 

Please provide all training documents related to the use of force within the agency, including but not limited to manuals, protocols, guidelines, and any related memos or communications.

I am making this FOIA request with any and all agencies that may have the requested information. The purpose of this request is to gather information that will aid in a research project examining agency practices related to use of force. Information requested will be used to assess the extent to which the agency training on the use of force has been effective. This research project is being conducted as part of a larger effort to promote greater accountability and transparency within law enforcement agencies. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by email attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to conduct a search the records you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted with a formal acknowledgement of your request in accordance with FOIL Law within five (5) business days. 
PLEASE NOTE: The State of New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you WILL receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the FOIL Records Center. 
Orange County 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOIL Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HSHl8-2BXrH0Emh1YnwY6awN482QiDeqX8ID9nRC-2BxKUuMbl3URICSd7vtbRg1D-2BlINFERsXSuOKRvQ8-2BWAPXakjc-3D5Qyt_L6oZ1hthide01sczOvz6e5kURLFR-2FRYnNCrL9QhFlxwjA4WLXVFDXDnQ8k2D-2FuPqSvC79BO5AUvyBEwnbHtyTZsgC75RtLQBvGooDPGSXLZ9KPftub2aeHRpBQzv-2FWdQ85MWd5vcdbEwpR1WA7KJsKaURXbcZIbW-2FYUrf3UwonmSZtLQ3mUWmgD2nIaBCVPO3-2F4bmflh08pe3Zd5rcqIJRPW5t8waS1aShacoue58FQ-3D)

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
RE: COUNTY FOIL REQUEST of April 28, 2023., Reference # R000506-042823. 
Dear Jordan Jordan: 
This letter will serve to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request dated April 28, 2023 pertaining to: "Subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Probation Departments: Employee Salaries and Use of Force Training Documents (Orange County) 

To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: I am writing to request the following information: 

A complete list of all employees, their job titles, and their annual salary for the last three years (2020 and 2023). 

Please provide all training documents related to the use of force within the agency, including but not limited to manuals, protocols, guidelines, and any related memos or communications.

The purpose of this request is to gather information that will aid in a research project examining agency practices related to use of force. Information requested will be used to assess the extent to which the agency training on the use of force has been effective. This research project is being conducted as part of a larger effort to promote greater accountability and transparency within law enforcement agencies. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by email attachment if available or CD-ROM if not." 
Please be advised that it could take up to twenty (20) business days to locate the records you seek, if indeed they are available and subject to disclosure under the Public Officers Law. We shall, of course, endeavor to have our search completed as quickly as possible.

RE: FOIL Request dated 4/26/23, 
received 4/28/23 

Dear Jordan: 
This Department has received and reviewed your FOIL Requests captioned above. 

With respect to Item #1 regarding employees, titles and annual salaries; Exhibits 1, 2, 3, and 4 are being provided in response.  The summaries are filed each Spring with the New York State (NYS) Office of Probation and Correctional Alternatives (OPCA).  The 2023 information (Exhibit 4) will be filed within the next 2 weeks.  The summaries provide the information you are seeking, while protecting personal identifying information. 
With respect to Item #2 and use of force training, all Orange County Probation Department training in these areas is conducted in accordance with NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services (DCJS) and the Municipal Police Training Council (MPTC) guidelines and regulations.  The guidelines and regulations may be obtained directly from those agencies.  With respect to Orange County Probation Department Policy, I am providing Exhibit 5, which contains pages 66 – 90 of our Policy Manual.  The release of any other information, including redacted information, pertaining to Item #2 is being denied pursuant to Section 87(2)(e)(i), (iv) and (2)(f). 
If you wish to apply any part of this determination, your appeal should be directed to: 
 
Richard B. Golden, Esq., County Attorney 
Orange County Department of Law 
255 -275 Main Street 
Goshen, NY 10924 
Respectfully submitted, 
Timothy A. Davidian 
Probation Director

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #R000506-042823
communications.communication:
Subject: Appeal for Inadequate Disclosure of Documents Under Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)

Dear Orange County Department of Probation FOIA Appeals Officer,

I am writing to formally appeal the response to my Freedom of Information Act request (Reference No: R000506-042823) dated April 3, 2023. While I appreciate the provided documents, the response falls short of the specific information I requested.

In my original request, I specifically asked for a complete list of all employees, their job titles, and their annual salaries for the last three years (2020 to 2023), as well as training documents. The documents I received only included general job titles and salaries and did not include the requested training documents. Specific employee names and their respective salaries were omitted. 

This absence of information does not satisfy the requirements of my original request. As per the Freedom of Information Law (Article 6, Sections 84-90, of the Public Officers Law), I am entitled to access this public information.

Moreover, as stated in NY Committee on Open Government Advisory Opinion, FOIL-AO-19074, "[...] records identifying public employees, their public employment history, and the salaries they receive are generally available to the public, for they are required to be maintained by an agency pursuant to law."

Therefore, I request that you reconsider your decision and provide the complete and specific information I originally requested. If the decision is upheld, I request an explanation for the reasons behind the decision, specifically detailing the FOIA exemptions applied to withhold this information.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response to this appeal within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(ii)).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: 1-845-748-0329
A letter stating that the request appeal has been rejected.
A copy of documents responsive to the request.

RE: SHERIFF FOIL REQUEST of April 03, 2023., Reference # P000419-040323. 
Dear Jordan Jordan, 
Orange County received a FOIL request from you on April 03, 2023. Your request mentioned: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

Regarding complaints filed against the Orange County Jail in New York State for the past five years, specifically from 2019 to 2023. 

I am seeking records related to any complaints made by inmates, their families, or staff members regarding the treatment of inmates, conditions of confinement, use of force by staff, and any incidents of misconduct or abuse by staff. This includes but is not limited to complaints related to: 

Physical abuse or assault by staff on inmates 
Use of excessive force or restraint methods 
Medical neglect or mistreatment 
Lack of access to necessary medications or medical care 
Inadequate food, water, or hygiene conditions 
Overcrowding or unsanitary conditions in living areas 
Discrimination or harassment based on race, gender, sexual orientation, or religion 
Violation of legal rights or due process procedures 
Failure to provide necessary mental health services or support 
Please provide any documents, reports, or other materials related to these complaints, including any investigation reports, disciplinary actions taken, and any corrective actions implemented by the jail. 

In order to assist with my request, please provide the following information for each complaint: 

Date the complaint was filed 
Name of the person who filed the complaint 
Nature of the complaint (i.e. use of force, medical neglect, etc.) 
Any actions taken in response to the complaint 
Outcome of any investigations or disciplinary proceedings related to the complaint 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Jordan

RE: SHERIFF FOIL REQUEST of April 03, 2023., Reference # P000419-040323. 
Dear Jordan Jordan, 
Orange County received a FOIL request from you on April 03, 2023. Your request mentioned: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 

Regarding complaints filed against the Orange County Jail in New York State for the past five years, specifically from 2019 to 2023. 

I am seeking records related to any complaints made by inmates, their families, or staff members regarding the treatment of inmates, conditions of confinement, use of force by staff, and any incidents of misconduct or abuse by staff. This includes but is not limited to complaints related to: 

Physical abuse or assault by staff on inmates 
Use of excessive force or restraint methods 
Medical neglect or mistreatment 
Lack of access to necessary medications or medical care 
Inadequate food, water, or hygiene conditions 
Overcrowding or unsanitary conditions in living areas 
Discrimination or harassment based on race, gender, sexual orientation, or religion 
Violation of legal rights or due process procedures 
Failure to provide necessary mental health services or support 
Please provide any documents, reports, or other materials related to these complaints, including any investigation reports, disciplinary actions taken, and any corrective actions implemented by the jail. 

In order to assist with my request, please provide the following information for each complaint: 

Date the complaint was filed 
Name of the person who filed the complaint 
Nature of the complaint (i.e. use of force, medical neglect, etc.) 
Any actions taken in response to the complaint 
Outcome of any investigations or disciplinary proceedings related to the complaint 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Jordan

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: 2023: Tarantula File, retrospective to 2010
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a copy of the tarantula file.

Please provide this file for SY2010 to current. This is the file that shows whether a school has an attendance boundary, how many students attend the school, how many students reside in the boundary, how many reside in the boundary and attend the school, how many attend but don't reside, how many reside but don't attend, , etc.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

12/22/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR156082 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N014597-121723 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(  ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
( ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Annie Righi 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: [External Message Added] University of Wyoming public records request #23-73
communications.communication:
University of Wyoming ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #23-73: Please see below for the fee letter for your request dated November 22, 2023. As there is no fee associated with this request, the University will move forward with processing. The University will comply with Wyoming law regarding disclosure of any responsive records, including reviewing for any applicable exemptions to disclosure. Once the University has had the opportunity to locate and review any potentially responsive records, I will respond accordingly. The anticipated date for release of any responsive records is January 3, 2024 or before, if possible. If the University is unable to release responsive records by that date, I will contact you to determine a mutually agreeable date for release of the records.  Fee Letter: The University of Wyoming has received your records request under the Wyoming Public Records Act dated November 22, 2023. The University of Wyoming Board of Trustees has adopted fees in its Fee Book found at http://www.uwyo.edu/administration/financial-affairs/feebook/ for the reasonable costs of producing and constructing an electronic public record consistent with Wyoming law. Fees will be charged only if they exceed $180.00. The initial $180.00 will be a credit and not charged to the applicant.   Production and construction costs exceeding $180.00 will be charged as follows:   $15.50/hour for clerical staff time $30.00/hour for information technology staff time $40.00/hour for professional staff time Actual cost of programming and computer services.   Please review the enclosed invoice for your electronic public records request. Consistent with the University’s rules, you must pre-pay the estimated costs as detailed in the invoice before the University begins any work relating to your request. Checks should be made payable to: University of Wyoming. Please note that if the estimated costs are below the $180 credit, the University will begin processing the request at this time.  If the University reaches the limit of payment for this request, we will provide the records available at that time and provide you with an additional cost estimate/invoice prior to continuing with the request for the remaining records. If your payment exceeds the actual time and amount spent on your request, any applicable refunds will be sent at the same time the records become available for inspection or upon delivery of the records. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at University of Wyoming.
Technical support: See our help page

communications.communication:
Dear e e, Thank you for registering with the Village of Oak Brook FOIA Center. The current login for your account is [CUST_LOGIN]. Please log in to the FOIA Center to update any contact or password information. Village of Oak Brook Click Here to Login (https://oakbrookil.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/supporthome.aspx) If you experience an issue with our FOIA system not operating correctly, we recommend that you use the Google Chrome internet browser and try again.  If the issue remains we recommend that you clear your computer’s cache memory.   Your computer’s cache memory is the name for a portion of your hard drive that is dedicated to storing browser files that your browser determines it may need to use again. Web pages are packed with information, and this information is stored in dozens, hundreds and sometimes thousands of files for just one site. Your browser will cache portions of the page for you so in future visits load times are quicker, improving your overall internet experience.  It's always a good idea to clear out the cache, or browser history, and clear cookies on a regular basis.   Please copy/paste this link to clear the cache files on your computer: 
https://uploads.govqa.us/WEBQASUPPORT/ClearingBrowserCacheUpdated19_2.pdf

DATED: 01/03/2024 

e e 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR156065 
Boston, MA 02115 

RE: Freedom of Information Request - Other: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Fusus. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpolice-department-22009%252Ffoia-request-fusus-156065%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540oak-brook.org&url_auth_token=AAB-iv0NzLXBsv8qTcWWit7H54Q%3A1rF2t7%3AoAqSpPqjh1P3hcla7bEglr4liJ4ZaFLKV5vIarNnqw8 

Dear e e: 

On 12/17/2023 7:59:46 PM, the Village of Oak Brook received your written request for inspection, copying, or certification of the Village public records described above. Please be advised that as of today the only available documents are ones attached, approved at the Regular Board of Trustee Meetings. Please note that per the Police Department is not in possession of any other or additional requested documents. Therefore no records exist for those portions of the request. Please see section 5 below for redactions and do not hesitate to reach out with questions or concerns. 
1.             Decision on Request 

___       Your request is approved in its entirety. 
X        Your request is approved in part and denied in part.  Those records for which your request is denied are identified in Section 5 below. 

___       Your request is hereby denied in its entirety.  Those records for which your request is denied are identified in Section 5 below. 
2.             Availability of Records 

The response to your request is not subject to payment of any required fees or postage, and pursuant to the sections below, all of the public records for which your request is approved will be made available as follows.  (See Section 5 for the public records for which your request is denied.) 

Copies of the following public records will be: 

___       Made available for your inspection at the Village Hall as indicated in Section 3 below. 

___       Made available for pick up by you at the Village Hall as indicated in Section 3 below. 

___       Mailed to you at the address you provided in your request. 
_x__       Sent to you via email at the email address you provided in your request. 
3.             Appointment for Inspection or Pick‑up 

___       The Records are available for inspection or pick‑up at Village Hall.  You must call the FOIA Officer at _________________ to schedule an appointment for inspection or pick up of the records. 

If you have not made an appointment to inspect or pick up the specified records within five Business Days after the date of this Notice, then the records will be re-filed. 

___       Pursuant to Sections 2(c-10) and 3.1 of the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, the Village has determined that your request is made for commercial purposes, or the Village has determined that you are a recurrent requester pursuant to Sections 2(g) and 3.2 of the Act.  The records therefore will be available for inspection or pick-up on or after ________________, 20___ (the “Availability Date”).  If you do not make an appointment to inspect or pick up the records on or before the fifth Business Day after the Availability Date, then the records will be re-filed. 
4.             Mailing of Records 

___       Your request to have the records mailed to you has been denied because you have not shown that it would be unduly burdensome for you to arrange to pick up the records. 

___       Your request to have the Village mail the specified records to you has been approved.  However, before the Village will mail the specified records, you must pay the balance, if any, and the following additional amount to cover the cost of postage:  $________________. 
5.             Denial of Request 

Your request is denied as to the following records or redacted information contained in those records: private or personal information 

A. Responsible Official.  The Village’s FOIA Officer is the official responsible for this denial. 

B. Notice of Right to Review by Illinois Attorney General.  You have the right to file a request for review of your request and this Notice of Denial by the Public Access Counselor of the Office of the Illinois Attorney General.  The Public Access Counselor may be contacted at 500 South 2nd Street, Springfield, Illinois 62701, by telephone at (877)299-3642 or by email at public.access@ilag.gov. 

C. Notice of Right to Judicial Review.  Under Section 11 of the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/11, you have the right to seek judicial review of this denial.  The Village cannot advise or represent you in this matter.  You should consult your own legal counsel. 

D. Justification for Denial.  Your request is being denied with respect to the specified records because the specified records are exempt from disclosure pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act for the following reason or reasons (references are to sections of the Act): 
X        The records are private information. § 2(c-5), §7(1)(b) 
Applies to: signatures and banking information, including account numbers, wire transfer numbers, etc. 

___     Disclosure of the records would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. §1, §7(1)(c) 

Sincerely, 

Sylwia Slodyczka 
FOIA Officer 
Village of Oak Brook 
1200 Oak Brook Rd. Oak Brook, IL 60523 

Phone:   630.368.5032 
Fax:   630.368.5033 

Web: http://www.oak-brook.org 

This electronic message and any attached files contain information intended for the exclusive use of the individual(s) or entity to whom it is addressed and may contain information that is proprietary, confidential and/or exempt from disclosure under applicable law, including protected health information (PHI). If you are not the intended recipient or the employee or agent, you are hereby notified that any viewing, copying, disclosure or distribution of the information may be subject to legal restriction or sanction and is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender by return electronic message or telephone, and destroy the original message without making any copies. Unless otherwise stated, any opinions expressed in this electronic message are those of the author and are not endorsed by the Village. 
Electronic messages sent to and from the Village of Oak Brook may be subject to discovery under the IL Freedom of Information Act.
